definition: to adjust to the right value/to tune/to focus (a camera etc)/to set (the date, the time) to the correct value
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of

sentences.english: Would you help me to line up my watch?
sentences.chinese: 你能协助我把我的表调准吗？

sentences.english: Would you help me to line up my watch ?
sentences.chinese: 你能帮助我把我的表调准吗？

sentences.english: The workers have timed the speed of the machine.
sentences.chinese: 工人们已经调准机器的速度。

sentences.english: Before you take photos, please adjust the focus of your camera.
sentences.chinese: 在照相之前请调准照相机的焦距。

sentences.english: He took out the camera and brought it into focus.
sentences.chinese: 他拿出相机并调准了焦距。

sentences.english: A sail draws by being properly trimmed and filled with wind.
sentences.chinese: 船帆经调准适应风向后便扯满风。

sentences.english: This paper has introduced a pseudo-adjustment algorithm.
Manual vision alignment and dual squeegee head options available.
sentences.chinese: 人工视觉调准和双刮刀头可供选择。

sentences.english: Adjust all clocks at mid-night by zone time signal.
sentences.chinese: 在午夜用时区信号调准所有时钟。

sentences.english: It needs skill to tune a piano.
The entropy adaptative aggregation algorithm is proposed to simplify the computation.
sentences.chinese: 在此基础上提出熵调准聚合算法，简化计算的复杂性。

definition: to wind/to tighten/crescent moon/first quarter or waxing moon
to proofread and correct/to edit and rectify/to correct/to calibrate
bow string/string of musical instrument/watchspring/chord (segment of curve)/hypotenuse/CL:根[gen1]
to stir/to prod/to poke/to move sideways/to strum (on a guitar etc)
tuning (stringed instrument)/(fig.) to make up one's mind
